Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Halocin C8 (HalC8, natural AMPs; microhalocins, archaeocins, archaea, prokaryotes; 5S=S; UCSS1)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against a sensitive strain of Halorubrum saccharovorum. Also, Hrr. chaoviator ETD3, Nnm. altunense JCM12890, Nnm. versiforme DSM16034, Nnm. salaciae DSM25055, Natrinema sp. SSI9, Natrinema sp. SWI6, Nnm. pallidum DSM15623n, Htg. salina JCM13891, Nnm. gari JCM14663, Nnm. ejinorense DSM18194, Nnm. pellirubrum DSM15624, Htg. thermotolerans DSM11552, Htg. turkmenica DSM5511, Htg. hispanica DSM18328, and Htg. jeotgali DSM18794.MOA:archaea: probably on cell wall of the sensitive strain.Peptide stability: Its thermostability is attributed to the 5 S-S bonds (Besse et al., 2017).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: 6.2 mg/L (95%) was obtained (Ri et al., 2023). Found in multiple species.  Updated 2/2020; 8/2023
Literature Information.Author: Li Y, Xiang H, Liu J, Zhou M, Tan H.2003
Literature Information.Title: Purification and biological characterization of halocin C8, a novel peptide antibiotic from Halobacterium strain AS7092.
